GT.content: Derrida links pheuin, phusis to donation, thus bringing nature & production together [sometimes opposed]; fortune (fate, chance, fors, luck, fortuity) and necessity are allied
GT.linkedContent: Derrida links pheuin, phusis to donation, thus bringing nature & production together [sometimes opposed]; fortune (fate, chance, fors, luck, fortuity) and necessity are allied

MC.content: Derrida links chance & necessity via Anankē, Tukhē, and Automatia

POOF.content: the unstable (inconstant), at the crossroads of chance & necessity, as necessary as the stable (bébaios), and already indispensable to Plato or Aristotle’s philosophy of friendship
POOF.linkedContent: the unstable (inconstant), at the crossroads of chance & necessity, as necessary as the stable (bébaios), and already indispensable to Plato or Aristotle’s philosophy of friendship

PAS.content: chance and necessity de la langue, la nécessité, la chance, marque encore la chance, the risk: que l’autre de la langue se passe dans le pas au-delà de la langue, not its other but the other sans elle (language)
PAS.linkedContent: chance and necessity de la langue, la nécessité, la chance, marque encore la chance, the risk: que l’autre de la langue se passe dans le pas au-delà de la langue, not its other but the other sans elle (language)

SH.content: w/in stricture of cipher # 13 [re: Celan’s February 13th] chance & necessity are bound together, fatality & chance
SH.linkedContent: w/in stricture of cipher # 13 [re: Celan’s February 13th] chance & necessity are bound together, fatality & chance

DS.content: difference  is the necessary interval, suspense btwn 2 outcomes, “lapse of time” btwn 2 shots, rolls, chances > a game of chance forever new, a play of fire forever young > fire & games (via Nietzsche, Heraclitus), play of luck w/ necessity: a hymen btwn chance & rule
DS.linkedContent: difference is the necessary interval, suspense btwn 2 outcomes, “lapse of time” btwn 2 shots, rolls, chances > a game of chance forever new, a play of fire forever young > fire & games (via Nietzsche, Heraclitus), play of luck w/ necessity: a hymen btwn chance & rule

DS.content: désertant toute profondeur, chacune de ses faces est aussi, après coup, tout le dé ——in a hymen depending on verse, blank once more, composed of chance & necessity, writing prepares to receive the seminal spurt of a throw of dice
DS.linkedContent: désertant toute profondeur, chacune de ses faces est aussi, après coup, tout le dé ——in a hymen depending on verse, blank once more, composed of chance & necessity, writing prepares to receive the seminal spurt of a throw of dice

DS.content: roll die in hymen, write, seminal spurt: hasard selon le programme génétique > limited to 6 surfaces [each guarding chance]
DS.linkedContent: roll die in hymen, write, seminal spurt: hasard selon le programme génétique > limited to 6 surfaces [each guarding chance]

ROP.content: inability to identify w/ oneself, unify oneself, gather oneself > alliance of destiny, namely tragedy, and chance as the possible or aleatory [no pertinence to dramatization]
ROP.linkedContent: inability to identify w/ oneself, unify oneself, gather oneself > alliance of destiny, namely tragedy, and chance as the possible or aleatory [no pertinence to dramatization]

O.content: adventurous excess of writing not improv., throw of dice doesn’t contradict rigorous necessity of its “formal assemblage”: unity of chance & rule, program and its leftovers or extra (son reste ou de son surplus) [literature or book: atheistic face of this play, conflagration achieved, final clause located sur la tranche du livre fermé]
O.linkedContent: adventurous excess of writing not improv., throw of dice doesn’t contradict rigorous necessity of its “formal assemblage”: unity of chance & rule, program and its leftovers or extra (son reste ou de son surplus) [literature or book: atheistic face of this play, conflagration achieved, final clause located sur la tranche du livre fermé]

PIO.content: logic distinguishing chance from method and method of invention from method of pedagogical expositions—calls for deconstruction > it’s in this way that deconstruction is no longer subject to this logic
PIO.linkedContent: logic distinguishing chance from method and method of invention from method of pedagogical expositions—calls for deconstruction > it’s in this way that deconstruction is no longer subject to this logic

PIO.content: supplementarity introduces (into structure of psyche) the fabulous repetition, a crossing of chance & necessity, bending performative rules while respecting them: allows other to come, or announce’s its coming, in dehiscence’s opening > deconstruction
PIO.linkedContent: supplementarity introduces (into structure of psyche) the fabulous repetition, a crossing of chance & necessity, bending performative rules while respecting them: allows other to come, or announce’s its coming, in dehiscence’s opening > deconstruction

TR.content: French à propos allies necessity & chance, accidental (machinelike) relation to organic, obligatory link; esprit d’à-propos: the art, the genius, the technique of grabbing a chance, making of Khairos or Chaos a significant, archivable, even ineffaceable event
TR.linkedContent: French à propos allies necessity & chance, accidental (machinelike) relation to organic, obligatory link; esprit d’à-propos: the art, the genius, the technique of grabbing a chance, making of Khairos or Chaos a significant, archivable, even ineffaceable event

TR.content: Catholicism: literalist & mechanistic religion of the à propos
TR.linkedContent: Catholicism: literalist & mechanistic religion of the à propos

TR.content: logic of à propos—logic of substitution [cf. p. 149]

offered chance [for you the reader to preserve Rousseau’s destiny] is also a wager, logic/economy of wager: by wagering on future [by appealing to survival], you will win at every throw > bearing witness to your goodness/justice [if you watch over Rousseau’s manuscript]
TR.linkedContent: offered chance [for you the reader to preserve Rousseau’s destiny] is also a wager, logic/economy of wager: by wagering on future [by appealing to survival], you will win at every throw > bearing witness to your goodness/justice [if you watch over Rousseau’s manuscript]

D.content: violent, arbitrary cut, scission (la coupure) necessary because beginning se plie et se multiplie; coupe-papier (letter-opener), la lame (sharp blade) de la décision, tranchant (cutting edge); la répétition hasardeuse et nécessaire du déjà-là d’un (autre) texte
D.linkedContent: violent, arbitrary cut, scission (la coupure) necessary because beginning se plie et se multiplie; coupe-papier (letter-opener), la lame (sharp blade) de la décision, tranchant (cutting edge); la répétition hasardeuse et nécessaire du déjà-là d’un (autre) texte

C.content: lot: chance & necessity nicely shared (bien partagée) > contingent says the same, less well, & doesn’t share
C.linkedContent: lot: chance & necessity nicely shared (bien partagée) > contingent says the same, less well, & doesn’t share
